citations.narrative:
On Tuesday 6/25/24, a member of a research lab reported that he found one female singing mouse (tag #348, ID number
is 77-13-2) dead in a cage. When he looked in the cage, he noted that no water bottle was present. Daily checks are
conducted twice daily by vivarium staff. When the animal was first separated by the lab on Friday 6/21/24 and returned to
housing on the afternoon of Monday 6/24/24, a water bottle was present. Staff stated that it is unclear what happened to
the water bottle between Monday afternoon and Tuesday, when the animal was found dead. A necropsy was performed
and results concluded that the animal was dehydrated and most likely died due to an absence of water. Appropriate
corrective actions, including more daily checks, an additional checklist to verify if there is a water bottle present, and
increasing the QA/QC program were established immediately by the facility. Potable water must be provided as often as
necessary for the health and comfort of the animal. Frequency of watering shall consider age, species, condition, size,
and type of animal.
CORRECTION DATE: CORRECTED PRIOR TO INSPECTION ON 14 MAY 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
